definition:
If $R$ is a ring, the *Krull dimension* (or simply dimension) of $R$,
$\dim R$ is the supremum of all integers $n$ such that there is an
increasing sequence of prime ideals
$\mathfrak{p}_0 \subsetneq \cdots \subsetneq \mathfrak{p}_n$ of length
$n$ in $R$.

If $X$ is a topological space, the Krull dimension (or simply dimension)
of $X$, $\dim X$ is the supremum of all integers $n$ such that there is
a decreasing sequence of irreducible closed subsets
$F_0 \supsetneq \cdots \supsetneq F_n$ of $X$.
